7.After the application is approved by the central health competent authority and an official approval letter is issued, the manufacturer should carry out the clinical trial in accordance to the comments from the assessment results.  After the completion of the clinical trial, the results should be submitted for inspection.
8.Any changes occurring after the central health competent authority’s issuance of approval of the clinical trials, the applicant should apply for post-approval changes.
9.Without the central health competent authority’s assessment and approval of the trial results, applications for drug registration and post-approval changes will not be approved.

Except as otherwise regulated in this Chapter, the authorization letter, batch record and manufacturing & controls standard, form for sticking changed licenses and certificates, attachments of references and research reports, the data field of applicant on the application form, and toll-manufacturing & contract analysis shall comply with Article 5, Article 6, Article 11, Article 12, Article 13, Article 16 Paragraph 1 and Paragraph 3 and Article 23 respectively.
In any of the situations listed in Article 25 or in duplicated applications of products with the same formula basis and the same dosage form (not just changing the sizes of pills, tablets or capsules), the applications shall be rejected.

法規內容.編章節: Section 2 Chinese Medicine Review and Registration

法規內容.條文內容: When applying for Chinese medicine registration, the applicant shall provide photocopies of documents to justify that the hardware, software and dosage form equipment of the manufacturers have complied with the standards of Pharmaceutical Good Manufacturing Practice Regulations. For toll-manufactured products, applications shall include all manufacturers involved in every aspect of the manufacturing processes.

When applying for new drug registration for Chinese medicine, the applicant should submit a full application dossier, local clinical trial reports and technical data as required by the central health competent authority in official announcements.
Licenses of drugs with the same dosage form but of different doses should be applied for separately.

If more than two applications of compound preparations, or six applications of single ingredient preparations, or one application of compound preparation plus three applications of single ingredient preparations are to be filed in the same month, the applicant should apply for an approval by giving reasons and providing information on the manufacturer, including information of the equipment and technical staffs of the manufacturing and quality control departments and the manufacturer’s actual manufacturing capacity.  This information has to be confirmed by the central health competent authority through dossier assessment or site inspection of the quality control, production records, sample manufacturing processes, on-site supervision situation, etc.
Applications for drug registration from newly established plants have higher priority over others for assessment.  The case number allowed for special application of preparations of concentrated extracts from new plant is at most 100 for combination preparations and 50 for single ingredient preparations.  Those plants are exempt from the restrictions set out in the preceding paragraph.  However, each time, one special application can only contain, at most, 24 cases.

法規內容.編章節: Section 3 Post-Approval Changes of Chinese Medicine

法規內容.條文內容: The application form for post-approval changes of toll-manufactured Chinese medicine should be signed by both parties.

In principle, if a change in the formula of a Chinese medicine involves changes of active ingredients, then the applicant shall re-apply for drug registration.  Applications for changes in excipients stated in the preceding article is applicable to cases of removing cinnabar or protected medical materials, cases based on standard formulas, or cases of proportional changes of ingredients of a formula.

Assurance Statement (A) is required for the applications of toll-manufacturing Chinese medicine products and the applications of manufacturing a product used in toll-manufacturing.   Article 64 and Article 65 are also applicable; however, some documents would not be required, including the manufacturing and controls standard mentioned in Article 64 Paragraph 1 Item 7 and the data mentioned in Item 10 of the same article, as well as the data mentioned in Article 65 Paragraph 7 and Paragraph 8.  These documents should be retained by the manufacturer for future inspection.
Article 66 is applicable to the contract analysis of Chinese medicine.

Article 47, 57 and 60 to 63 are all applicable to post-approval changes for Chinese medicine, respectively for the notification letter for post-approval changes issued by the original manufacturer, changes in testing specifications and methods, changes in the drug company name and address (including manufacturer), changes in labels, package inserts, outer boxes and aluminium blister foil (bag), and the reissuance of the original approved copy.

法規內容.編章節: Section 4 Chinese Medicine License Transfer, Renewal and Reissuance

法規內容.條文內容: Articles 70 and 71 are applicable to the transfer of license and the reissuance of lost and damaged licenses for Chinese medicine.   The manufacturing and control standard mentioned in Article 70 Paragraph 1 Item 5 Point 5 would not be required; but this document should be retained by the manufacturer for future inspection.
The Regulations take effect starting from the date of promulgation.
